Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: Being a couple years out of college with full-time jobs, it's hard to travel for long, so Montreal for a weekend was a good destination from NYC. My friend and I just came back from a weekend to see a concert and we stayed here on Friday and Saturday nights. We arrived late Friday night, after 1:30am, and the staff at the front desk was very friendly despite the few French words and phrases we know. I had made a reservation a few weeks prior through their website for 1 room with 2 beds and upon opening the door to the room, I found exactly that. Comfortable and basic. It faced the back, and I thought that I would be woken up by outside noise Saturday morning because we kept the window open but I was pleasantly surprised to find it was very quiet both nights. A few downsides were that there is no elevator and our room was on the 5th (top) floor, the toilet was located a bit too close to the wall in the bathroom and the shower had no light and the curtain was not sufficient in keeping the water within the shower stall. All in all, this quintessential no-frills hotel, which is reminiscent of a European hostel, served our purpose and we felt it was a great value. I'd consider staying here again if I'm planning to return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones; not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Catherine G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, conveniently located, and well-priced, with friendly staff. Had no problems with booking or check-in, although it seemed odd that we were asked to pay in full upon checking in. Perhaps a lot of guests depart early? We did - none of the people in our party could get a good night's sleep due to noise - the front rooms face a bus terminal and hear buses idling and beeping when they back up, at all hours of the night. Another room toward the back of the building shared an air duct with the room across the hall, and we could pretty much hear every word the neighbors spoke. Seems like a safe, friendly bargain hotel for young travelers who plan to stay out late anyway, but not a good choice for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service!”
Reviews.Author: soujournals
Reviews.Content: Great service, the ladies and gentlemen at the desk were so friendly. The room was clean and had wifi, and the coffee delicious! And of course it is very close to the station centrale. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryn K
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed in this hotel when I visited Montreal from Toronto and it was perfect for my budget! The rooms are neat and clean and it is conveniently located close to the Metro, City Bus Terminal, Restaurants and shopping area. The rates were very reasonable. I really had a good time talking to the staff and getting to know them. They were very nice and friendly people and they helped me plan my tour of Montreal and Quebec and gave me advice on what to see, where to go etc. So if you are looking for a few nights to spend in montreal at a reasonable rate, with really friendly staff, this is the hotel of your choice!:D

Reviews.Title: “Very Much A Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: C0rnc0b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here purely for the location, as it's right by the bus station and we needed to catch a bus out the next morning. And it was fine for that. Also can see it might be a decent option for travellers on a tight budget, it's cheap enough. Rooms are dated and small (shower was very cramped), but clean enough. Breakfast is basic bread to toast and jam and coffee, but again you're very much getting what you pay for. Staff were polite.

Reviews.Title: “Family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dmitri k
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel and found the experience very pleasant. Paying more than reasonable price, you will find rooms clean and comfortable, and staff friendly and helpful. Not to mention that hotel is located close to the shopping area. Next time I will visit Montreal, I am definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: urfin_jus
Reviews.Content: I've seen 2 rooms; both adequate but rather small. The bathrooms are small and quite basic; in one case, there was hardly any room to sit on the toilet without turning sideways: the seat almost touched the wall. The "breakfast" is wunderbread, coffee, concentrated orange juice, prepackaged jelly and peanut butter. Available almost to mid-day, so don't worry to miss it. The neighborhood is lousy but well connected; it's across the street from the bus station and a subway station. The staff is helpful; no problems there, but you never know who you will get next door. I recommend for students and people travelling on business and on a tight budget; certainly not your romantic getaway hiding.

Reviews.Title: “No Charm”
Reviews.Author: missflea1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the Vieux Port, Rue St. Denis, etc., but its location right behind the bus station (a lot of bus drivers stay here, by the way) lacks any charm and is VERY noisy, at least if you have a room facing the street, like I did. The staff is friendly (they happily watched my bicycle while I ran upstairs--there's no elevator, by the way--to grab something from my room, and they also happily lent me the desk phone to make free local phone calls), and the place is clean enough, but the interior, furniture, and all details are badly in need of a renovation. The shower rod and towel rod in my bathroom kept falling off, and there were water damage stains on the ceiling above my dresser. The staff told me they were planning on renovating some rooms soon. Breakfast, which is included, is barebones--white bread, butter, jam, canned orange juice, coffee, and that's about it. Overall, despite the pleasant staff, I wouldn't recommend this place for the price (about CAD$ 80 per night.)
